snippet: A regulatory change that would allow companies more discretion in deciding what is “material” information arouses concern among investors and auditors.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column observes Financial Accounting Standards Board has upset investor groups and audit experts with proposal that would change definition of materiality, financial disclosure that dictates what firm must tell investors about results.
lead_paragraph: A regulatory change that would allow companies more discretion in deciding what is “material” information arouses concern among investors and auditors.

headline.print_headline: Board Hurls a Bombshell Into Auditing
headline.main: FASB Proposes to Curb What Companies Must Disclose
